In 1920 Vladimir Schibayev, while being in [[London]], met Nicholas and Helena Roerichs. In [[Riga]] they created a group of people to study Agni Yoga and another theosophical literature. In 1928, Schibayev went to [[India]], to become the secretary of Roerich.{{cite web |url=http://www.latvijasrerihabiedriba.lv/images/RXLVang.htm |title=In short about Latvian Roerich Society |publisher=latvijasrerihabiedriba |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73quP4eRE?url=http://www.latvijasrerihabiedriba.lv/images/RXLVang.htm |archivedate=11 November 2018}} In Riga the place of the leader of Latvian Roerich Society was taken by [[Doctor (title)|doctor]]-[[Homeopathy|homeopath]] [[:lv:Fēlikss Lūkins|Felix Lukin.]] [[Dr.]] Felix Lukin and his son Dr. [[:lv:Haralds Lūkins|Harald Lukin]] conducted [[clinical trials]] are many natural [[medication]]s that they received from [[Svetoslav Roerich]] of the Himalayan Research Institute named ''Urusvati''.{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=xB-0B1OWsbIC&pg=PA144&lpg=PA144&dq=Feliks+Lukin&source=bl&ots=9sr1G3-LjI&sig=BOFxH1ypWEF0Mff4E_p4yCgnFWc&hl=ru&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwikrLTm8JbeAhUFposKHVn1DlA4ChDoATAFegQIBBAB#v=onepage&q=Feliks%20Lukin&f=false |title=History and status of homoeopathy around the world |author=Aswarda Das |publisher=books.google.com |isbn=81-8056-573-4 |year=2005 |pages=144-147 |accessdate=21 October 2018}} In 1936 [[:lv:Rihards Rudzītis|Rihard Rudzitis]] officially became the president of the Latvian Society. During his lead, the books of Living Ethics, the works by the Roerichs, [[Helena Blavatsky]]’s and works by Rudzitis himself were published. In 1937 the first conference of [[Baltic states|Baltic]] Roerich Societies took place. The Latvian Society was renewed at the [[Soviet Union]] in 1988. Dr. Harald Lukin carried the Roerichs [[Banner of Peace]]. The new president Gunta Rudzite, the daughter of Rihard Rudzitis, held contacts with many people of the republics in the [[USSR]] who were interested in the ideas of Agni Yoga. On 2005 the Roerich Society received a social beneficial status in the [[Republic of Latvia]]. ===Master Institute of United Arts in New York City=== Nicolas Roerich is known as a thinker and a builder of life. His art and writings are an evocation to Beauty, to Knowledge, and to Culture. His vision is nicely captured in his philosophical statement of the Master Institute of United Arts which he formed in [[New York City]] in 1921:{{cite web |url=https://blog.philosophicalsociety.org/2017/07/12/nicholas-roerichs-symbolic-journey/ |title=Inspired By Art: Nicholas Roerich’s Symbolic Journey |publisher=philosophicalsociety.org |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qumopSR?url=https://blog.philosophicalsociety.org/2017/07/12/nicholas-roerichs-symbolic-journey/ |archivedate=11 November 2018}} {{quote|''Art will unify all humanity. Art is one – indivisible. Art has its many branches, yet all are one. Art is the manifestation of the coming synthesis. Art is for all''.}} Mr. and Mrs. Horch financed and directed the Master Institute that taught the fine and dramatic arts. For much of its existence, the Master Institute was housed in the [[Master Apartments]], designed by Harvery Wiley Corbett in 1929 for Roerich and built on the site of the former Horch mansion at 310 Riverside Dr. in New York City.{{cite web |url=http://www.columbia.edu/cu/lweb/archival/collections/ldpd_6636038/ |title=Louis L. and Nettie S. Horch Papers, 1920s-1960s |publisher=columbia.edu |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qvS9UnN?url=http://www.columbia.edu/cu/lweb/archival/collections/ldpd_6636038/ |archivedate=11 November 2018}} Roerich planned to realize the educational concepts at the Institute. He invited as teachers such famous people as [[George Bellows]], [[Claude Fayette Bragdon]], [[Norman Bel Geddes]], [[Stark Young]], [[Deems Taylor]], [[Robert Edmond Jones]], and [[Lee Simonson]].{{cite web |url=http://www.roerich.org/roerich-biography.php |title=Nicholas Roerich Biography America |publisher=Nicholas Roerich Museum New York |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qvhsopy?url=http://www.roerich.org/roerich-biography.php |archivedate=11 November 2018}} Intensive work was in process under direct supervision of Roerich. Nicholas gave lectures, organized new classes, for example classes of music and sculpture for the blind. Many representatives of American science and culture expressed their willingness to educate students according with the proposed curriculum. There were [[Felix Salmond]], [[Ernest Bloch]], and [[Michael Fokin]]. In the ''Institute of United Arts in New York City'' also taught [[Rockwell Kent]], [[Claude Bragdon]], [[George Bellows]], and [[Norman Bel Geddes]].{{cite web |url=http://www.roerich-izvara.ru/eng/museum/roerich-and-america-13.htm |author=O. A. Cherkasova|title=N. K. Roerich and America |publisher=Nicholas Roerich Estate Museum in [[:ru:Извара (Волосовский район)|Izvara]] ([[Leningrad Region]]) |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qvwTzjw?url=http://www.roerich-izvara.ru/eng/museum/roerich-and-america-13.htm |archivedate=11 November 2018}} Some contemporaries were skeptical spiritual mission of Nicholas Roerich. But those who embraced his philosophy experienced something transformative in his canvases. Roerich's name is universally known not only as Master of the brush but also as a thinker and a builder of life. The works of the Artist are an evocation to Beauty, to Knowledge, and to Culture.{{cite web |url=https://blog.philosophicalsociety.org/tag/master-institute-of-united-arts/ |title=Tag Archives: Master Institute of United Arts |publisher=The Masonic Philosophical Society |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qwQmTGL?url=https://blog.philosophicalsociety.org/tag/master-institute-of-united-arts/ |archivedate=11 November 2018}} ===Himalayan Research Institute named ''Urusvati'' in India=== [[File:Urusvati base.jpg |thumb |240px |left |Himalayan Research Institute named ''Urusvati'' in [[Naggar]] ([[Himachal Pradesh]], [[India]]).{{cite web |url=https://www.rbth.com/articles/2012/05/02/nicholas_roerichs_legacy_lives_on_in_himalayan_hamlet_15652 |author=Ajay Kamalakaran |title=Nicholas Roerich’s legacy lives on in Himalayan Hamlet |publisher=rbth.com |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qwnrgWC?url=https://www.rbth.com/articles/2012/05/02/nicholas_roerichs_legacy_lives_on_in_himalayan_hamlet_15652 |archivedate=11 November 2018}}]] Roerich's family moved to [[India]] in December 1923. They settled in [[Darjeeling]], a town in the [[India]]n [[States and union territories of India|state]] of [[West Bengal]]. It is located in the [[Lower Himalayan Range]]s at an elevation of {{convert|6700|ft|1|abbr=on}}.{{cite web |url=http://ignca.gov.in/roerich-himalayan-museum-of-folk-and-tribal-art/ |title=Roerich Himalayan Museum Of Folk And Tribal Art |publisher=ignca.gov.in |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qx6ANWT?url=http://ignca.gov.in/roerich-himalayan-museum-of-folk-and-tribal-art/ |archivedate=11 November 2018}} From 1925 to 1928, Roerichs took part in a [[Central Asia]] expedition, that traveled through hard-to-reach and little-investigated regions of [[India]], [[China]], [[Soviet Union]], [[Mongolia]] and [[Tibet]]. [[Sikkim]] was the starting point of the expedition. During the expedition, research in topics such as [[history]], [[archeology]], [[ethnography]], [[history of philosophy]], [[arts]] and [[religions]], and [[geography]] was conducted. Rare manuscripts were found, and rich linguistic materials were collected. Special attention was paid to the problem of historical unity of cultures of various peoples. In 1925, Helena Roerich began to translate an extensive selection from ''[[The Mahatma Letters to A.P. Sinnett]]''. She also wrote a book named "Chalice of the East", which was published under the pen name "Iskander Khanum". Helena Roerich's manuscript "Foundations of Buddhism" was published in 1926, at [[Ulaanbaatar|Urga]], where her expedition was staying at the time. In this book, the fundamental philosophical notions of Buddha's Teaching were interpreted.{{cite web |url=http://www.found-helenaroerich.ru/eng/biography/ |title=Helena I. Roerich (1879-1955) philosopher, writer, spouse of Nicholas Roerich |publisher=found-helenaroerich.ru |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6j19KaUR8?url=http://www.found-helenaroerich.ru/eng/biography/ |archivedate=15 July 2016}} [[File:Юрий Рерих.jpg |thumb |180px |Prof. [[George de Roerich]], director of the Himalayan Research Institute named ''Urusvati''.{{cite web |url=http://www.roerich-izvara.ru/eng/museum/roerich-and-america-18.htm |title=N.K. Roerich and America |publisher=roerich-izvara.ru |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qycOJHd?url=http://www.roerich-izvara.ru/eng/museum/roerich-and-america-18.htm |archivedate=11 November 2018}}
The subtitle beneath the first picture: ''George Roerich – director of «Urusvati» Institute. Courtesy of N. Roerich Museum, New York''.]] The plethora of materials collected during the Central Asia Expedition became the foundation for the establishment of the Himalayan Research Institute named ''Urusvati'' in [[Darjeeling]] in 1928. A few months later the institute moved to [[Naggar]] in [[Kulu Valley]].{{cite web |url=https://www.alamy.com/nagar-himachal-pradesh-india-interior-of-the-roerich-estate-museum-where-the-russian-artist-philosopher-and-traveller-nicholas-roerich-settled-i-image183921077.html |title=Nagar, Himachal Pradesh, India : Interior of the Roerich Estate museum, where the Russian artist, philosopher and traveller Nicholas Roerich settled |publisher=alamy.com |accessdate=11 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73qyyMq3k?url=https://www.alamy.com/nagar-himachal-pradesh-india-interior-of-the-roerich-estate-museum-where-the-russian-artist-philosopher-and-traveller-nicholas-roerich-settled-i-image183921077.html |archivedate=11 November 2018}} The center engaged in scientific exchange with 285 institutes, universities, museums, and libraries around the world. [[George de Roerich]] was a world-renowned scientist, [[Oriental studies|orientalist]], and [[guru]].{{cite journal |url=http://biblmdkz.ru/j9.html |title=Удрая – наш Духовный Наставник |trans-title=Udraia (George Roerich's spiritual name) is our Guru |author=[[Victor Skumin|Skumin VA]] |year=2003 |journal=To Health via Culture |volume=9 |pages=3–12 |issn=0204-3440 |accessdate=14 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6vmc0Rh13?url=http://biblmdkz.ru/j9.html |archivedate=17 December 2017 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}} His monumental translation of the ''[[Blue Annals]]'' ({{bo|t=དེབ་ཐེར་སྔོན་པོ}}),{{cite web |url=https://books.google.ru/books?id=2R6OaXn76IgC&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q&f=false |author=[[George de Roerich|George N. Roerich]] |title=The Blue Annals Parts 1-2 |publisher=books.google.ru |pages=1141 |isbn=9788120804715 |accessdate=25 October 2018}} and his 11-volume ''[[Tibetic languages|Tibetan]]-Russian-English dictionary with [[Sanskrit]] parallels'' were published in 1934.{{cite web |url=http://www.theeuropeanlibrary.org/tel4/record/2000054567489?query=Tibetan-Russian-English+dictionary+ |title=The Tibetan-Russian-English dictionary with Sanskrit parallels |publisher=The European Library |accessdate=14 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6l9v7whq3?url=http://www.theeuropeanlibrary.org/tel4/record/2000054567489?query=Tibetan-Russian-English+dictionary+ |archivedate=10 October 2016 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}} One of his main focuses for the center was to bring people to the Institute who practiced and lived the cultures being examined by the center. George Roerich was the director of the Himalayan Research Institute named ''Urusvati'' for 10 years.{{cite web |url=http://en.icr.su/family/gnr/02.php |title=George Roerich /Yuri Nikolayevich Roerich (1902 – 1960) |publisher=en.icr.su |accessdate=14 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6l9vt9Cqs?url=http://en.icr.su/family/gnr/02.php |archivedate=10 October 2016}} [[File:S.Roerich Stamp.jpg |left |245px |thumb |[[Svetoslav Roerich]]. Russian postage stamp]] [[Svetoslav Roerich]] was in charge of the work of the Natural Sciences Department. He carried out unique researches in various fields of the [[natural sciences]]. At the basis of his scientific investigations was understanding of nature as one whole that is inalienably connected with the cosmic laws. The scope of his interests: [[cultural studies]], comparative religious studies and [[philosophy]], [[botany]], [[mineralogy]], tibetan [[pharmacopoeia]], [[chemistry]] and its [[alchemical]] sources.{{cite web |url=http://en.icr.su/family/snr/02.php |title=Svetoslav Nikolayevich Roerich (1904-1993) |publisher=en.icr.su |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73vcDuO2o?url=http://en.icr.su/family/snr/02.php |archivedate=14 November 2018 |accessdate=14 November 2018}} The work of the Himalayan Research Institute was based on wide international cooperation.{{cite journal |last=[[:cv:Ауновская Ольга Константиновна|Aunovska]] |first=Olga |date=1985 |title=Seeds of fraternity |url=http://biblmdkz.ru/articles/ukr485.html |journal=Ukraine |volume=4 |pages=14-15| accessdate=18 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6q87yYhVB?url=http://biblmdkz.ru/articles/ukr485.html |archivedate=1 May 2017}} Major [[scientist]]s and cultural workers collaborated with the Institute Urusvati. Such as Soviet academician [[Nikolai Vavilov]], biologist and biophysicist [[Jagadish Chandra Bose]], [[Bengalis|Bengali]] [[polymath]] [[Rabindranath Tagore]], the father of Indian journalism [[Ramananda Chatterjee]], Indian [[philosopher]] and [[Politician|statesman]] [[Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan]], Swedish geographer and explorer [[Sven Hedin]], and many others.{{cite web |url=http://en.icr.su/evolution/urusvati/03.php |title=The Light of the Morning Star |publisher=International Centre of the Roerichs |accessdate=14 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73vcVmjRJ?url=http://en.icr.su/evolution/urusvati/03.php |archivedate=14 November 2018}} ''The Journal of the Urusvati Himalayan Research Institute (U.J.)'' published articles on various aspects of science and culture. The publications presented a multi-level perception of the authors who were looking for a new integration of different cultural models in the mainstream of Agni Yoga.{{cite web |url=https://books.google.ru/books/about/Journal_Of_Urusvati_Himalayan_Research_I.html?id=yBO3pmzzhWkC&redir_esc=y |title=Journal Of Urusvati Himalayan Research Institute, Volumes 1-3 |publisher=books.google.ru |accessdate=24 September 2018 |isbn=9788179360118}} ===Nicholas Roerich Museum in New York City=== [[File:WTM3 The Fixers 0015.jpg |180px |thumb |right |[[Nicholas Roerich Museum, New York City]]]] {{Main|Nicholas Roerich Museum, New York City}} The Nicholas Roerich Museum in New York City was originally located in the Master Apartments at 103rd Street and [[Riverside Drive (Manhattan)]], which were built especially for Roerich in 1929. Now the museum is located in a brownstone at 319 West 107th Street on Manhattan's Upper West Side. This Museum is one of the most off-the-beaten-path of Manhattan's museums, a collection of works by Nicolas Roerich, who lived on the Upper West Side for a time in the 1920's. The brownstone is chock-full of amazing natural scenes from the Himalayas, where this artist spent two decades of his life. Roerich usually painted in stark tempera, with blazing orange skies or impossibly deep blue mountains.{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/04/16/travel/journeys-specialty-museums-finding-art-not-crowds-in-new-york.html |date=16 April 2006 |author=Seth Kugel |title=JOURNEYS: SPECIALTY MUSEUMS; Finding Art, Not Crowds, in New York. The Himalayan Upper West Side |publisher=[[The New York Times]] |accessdate=12 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6j1lZb6Mo?url=http://www.nytimes.com/2006/04/16/travel/journeys-specialty-museums-finding-art-not-crowds-in-new-york.html?_r=0 |archivedate=15 July 2016}} Currently, the museum includes between 100 and 200 of Roerich's works as well as a collection of archival materials and still attracts pilgrims from throughout the world. The mission of the Nicholas Roerich Museum is one: to make available to the public the full range of Roerich’s accomplishments. They cover the realms of art, science, spirituality, peacemaking, and more.{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=I5Kyo03NxncC&pg=PA86&dq=%22Nicholas+Roerich+Museum%22&ei=CfWySJWGBIyuyAT-uKz-Bg&sig=ACfU3U1VaGGP0xsNuixcSHcUcdMEJCcA3g |title=Spiritual Places| last=Squires| first=Emily| authorlink=Emily Squires |author2=Len Belzer |year=2000| pages=86 |publisher=Cosimo, Inc. |isbn=1931044031 |accessdate=17 September 2018}} The Museum seeks to realize the ideas of Agni Yoga on the role of culture in the evolution of the world and evolution of the human consciousness. Information about these Roerich's ideas is always available. The museum also provides an opportunity for young musicians to perform in front of an audience on a voluntary and free basis.{{cite web |url=http://www.roerich.org/museum-about.php?mid=about_en |title=Nicholas Roerich Museum New York |publisher=roerich.org |accessdate=14 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6j1nfmzWO?url=http://www.roerich.org/museum-about.php |archivedate=15 July 2016}} The Nicholas Roerich Museum in New York is the largest center of Roerich-related activity outside of [[Russian Federation]].{{cite web |url=http://www.isfp.co.uk/russian_thinkers/nikolay_roerich.html |title=Nikolay Roerich |publisher=isfp.co.uk |accessdate=14 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6p5R60yV5?url=http://www.isfp.co.uk/russian_thinkers/nikolay_roerich.html |archivedate=19 March 2017 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all }} ===International Non-governmental Organisation "The International Centre of the Roerichs"=== [[File:Зал Музея Рериха в Москве. 2014.JPG |thumb |240px |left |[[:ru:Международный центр Рерихов|International Center of the Roerichs]] (The hall of ''Living Ethics'') in 2014.]] ''The International Center of the Roerichs'' ([[Russian language|Russian]]: ''Междунаро́дный це́нтр Ре́рихов'') is a non-governmental public association of citizens and public associations incorporated on the basis of their common interests in the cause of study, preservation, and popularization of the Roerich family heritage. The Center is an associated member of the [[Non-Governmental Organization]]s Association under the [[United Nations Department of Public Information]]. Conducting its activities, this International public organization proceeds from the applicable the law of the states in which its structural divisions are acting, the [[United Nations Charter]], norms of the [[International law]] and International legal acts related to the Center’s sphere of activity.{{cite web |url=http://en.icr.su/about/statute/ |title=Extract from the Charter of the International public organization "International Center of the Roerichs" |publisher=en.icr.su |accessdate=17 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6pmrlZBwD?url=http://en.icr.su/about/statute/ |archivedate=17 April 2017 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}} ''Museum named after Nicholas Roerich'' ([[Russian language|Russian]]: ''Музе́й и́мени Н. К. Ре́риха Междунаро́дного це́нтра Ре́рихов'') contents comprises the Roerichs' cultural heritage passed on to the Soviet Roerichs' Foundation (now International Center of the Roerichs) by [[Svetoslav Roerich]] in 1990. It carries in itself a new cosmic world view for which new interest grows more each year. The core of the Rerikhism is the philosophy of cosmic reality – the Agni Yoga, which develops the idea of a close relationship between man and [[Cosmos]], contains knowledge which assists in understanding the specific features peculiar to the new evolutionary stage of mankind's development.{{cite web |url=http://en.icr.su/museum/ |title=The Nicholas Roerich Museum |accessdate=17 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6pms1o0eG?url=http://en.icr.su/museum/ |publisher=en.icr.su |archivedate=17 April 2017 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all }} ===The World Organisation of Culture of Health=== [[File:Victor Skumin 1997 Sikkim.jpg |thumb |220px |right |Prof. [[Victor Skumin]], president-founder of the WOCH.]] [[File:Victor Skumin 1995 Nepal.jpg |thumb |220px |right |The Board of the International Buddhist Meditation Centre]] ''The World Organisation of Culture of Health ('''WOCH''')'' — International [[Social movement organization|social movement]] ''To Health via Culture'' ([[Russian language|Russian]]: Междунаро́дное обще́ственное Движе́ние «К Здоро́вью че́рез Культу́ру») was founded in the year 1994. [[Victor Skumin]] was elected to the post of the President-founder of this organisation. The WOCH operates in accordance with the registered in [[Ministry of Justice (Russia)|Ministry of Justice of the Russian Federation]] Charter.{{cite web |url=http://kult-zdor.ru/?page_id=824 |title=Charter of the World Organisation of Culture of Health (Russian: Устав) |publisher=Kult-zdor.ru |accessdate=18 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6poMifaLN?url=http://kult-zdor.ru/?page_id=824 |archivedate=18 April 2017 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all }} In Agni Yoga much attention is paid to health. So in the book ''Supermundane'' (paragraph 525) recorded the words of [[Morya (Theosophy)|Master Morya]], addressed to Urusvati,{{cite web |url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Supermundane.php |title=Supermundane, 525 |publisher=agniyoga.org |accessdate=14 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73ATQDcyS?url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Supermundane.php |archivedate=14 October 2018}} {{quote|''Urusvati knows that people are responsible for three aspects of health. First, their own health; second, the health of the planet; and finally, the health of the Supermundane World... People must safeguard their own health, not only for themselves but also for those around them. The human organism, though seemingly small, is a powerful repository of energy, and truly dominates its earthly environment''.}} It is from these positions that WOCH approaches the solution of problems related to health.{{cite web |url= http://kult-zdor.ru/?page_id=5 |author=Victor A. Skumin |title=Culture of health is a science of future |publisher=The World Organisation of Culture of Health |accessdate=10 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6wFXbtCDp |archivedate=5 January 2018}} As ''Holy Scripture of Agni Yoga'' says, physicians can be true helpers of humanity in the ascent of the spirit. The intellect of a physician must be reinforced by his heart. The physician must be a psychologist, and he must not ignore the wondrous psychic energy.{{cite web| url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Aum.php |title=Aum, §3 |publisher=agniyoga.org |year=1936 |accessdate=14 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73ASzqsWl |archivedate=14 October 2018}} Prof. Verhorubova and Prof. Lobanova from [[Tomsk State Pedagogical University]] argued (2012) that in accordance with the concept of a culture of health, proposed by [[Victor Skumin|Skumin]], the culture – spiritual, mental, and physical – determines the status of human health. And health – spiritual, mental, physical – is a prerequisite for achieving a higher level of culture.{{cite journal |url= http://cyberleninka.ru/article/n/mnogoobrazie-opredeleniy-fenomena-kultura-zdorovya-kak-pokazatel-ego-mnogogrannosti-v-pedagogicheskom-obrazovanii |last2=Lobanova |first2=N.A. |last1= Verhorubova |first1=O.V. |title= Многообразие определений феномена "культура здоровья" как показатель его многогранности в педагогическом образовании |trans-title=The diversity of definitions the phenomenon of "culture of health" as an indicator of its versatility in education |journal=Вестник Томского государственного педагогического университета |year=2012 |issue=5 |pages=161–5 |accessdate=10 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6cKKxNxWb |archivedate=16 October 2015}} The World Organisation of Culture of Health, in order to promote international relations, has established a link with the International Buddhist Meditation Centre.{{cite web |url=https://www.facebook.com/ibmcnepal/videos/vb.242290825944809/670365706470650/?type=2&theater] |title=International Buddhist Meditation Centre |publisher=facebook.com |accessdate=20 September 2018}} The [[anthem]] of WOCH (''To Health via Culture'') consists of four [[stanzas]]. The capital letters each of the four stanzas form the word [[Agni]].{{cite book |last=Skumin |first=Victor |script-title=ru: Молитвы, гимны, притчи Культуры Здоровья |trans-title=Culture of Health: prayers, hymns, parables |year=2002 |location=[[Cheboksary]] |publisher=To Health via Culture |url=http://biblmdkz.ru/m.html |language=Russian |isbn=5-88167-018-3 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6vmcES03C?url=http://biblmdkz.ru/m.html |archivedate=17 December 2017 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all}}{{cite book |last=Skumin |first=Victor |script-title=ru: Гимны Культуры Здоровья |trans-title=Gimns of Culture of Health |year=2007 |location=[[Cheboksary]] |publisher=To Health via Culture |url=http://biblmdkz.ru/gimn.html |language=Russian |isbn=978-5-88167-030-6 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6vmcoqT4R?url=http://biblmdkz.ru/gimn.html |archivedate=17 December 2017 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all}} ({{YouTube|kyknqmZhyIk|''Anthem "To Health via Culture."''}}). Another anthem by [[Victor Skumin#Literary and publishing activities|Skumin]] is termed "Urusvati". [[Helena Roerich]], known as the ''[[Tara (Buddhism)|Tara]] Urusvati'' in Agni Yoga and [[Rerikhism]]. This anthem begins with the phrase, "The fire of the heart ignites Urusvati, she teaches the spirit take-off on the wings of the grace". Six more [[hymn]]s have the names: "Heart", "Shambhala", "Morya", "Ur", "Agni", and "Sun". In the [[Russian Orthodox Church]] the social activities of this international organization qualifies as an ideology of the Agni Yoga and [[New Age]] (NA),{{cite web |url=http://www.orthodox-institute.ru/biblioteka/materialyi-po-sektovedeniyu/okkultizm/grantsev-v.i.-kriticheskiy-analiz-ideologii-nyu-eydzh-i-otsenka-ee-obschestvennoy-opasnosti/ |last=Grantzev |first=V. I. |title=Критический анализ идеологии "Нью Эйдж" и оценка её общественной опасности |trans-title=A critical analysis of the ideology of the "New Age" and an assessment of its threat to society |publisher=Orthodox-institute.ru |accessdate=18 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6ppo9bwbU?url=http://www.orthodox-institute.ru/biblioteka/materialyi-po-sektovedeniyu/okkultizm/grantsev-v.i.-kriticheskiy-analiz-ideologii-nyu-eydzh-i-otsenka-ee-obschestvennoy-opasnosti/ |archivedate=19 April 2017 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all}}{{cite web |url=http://www.scienceandapologetics.org/text/85.htm |last=Grantzev |first=V. I. |title=Критический анализ идеологии "Нью Эйдж" и оценка ее общественной опасности. Текст |trans-title=A critical analysis of the ideology of the "New Age" and an assessment of its threat to society. Text |publisher=www.scienceandapologetics.org |accessdate=18 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6wFYIWHqW?url=http://www.scienceandapologetics.org/text/85.htm |archivedate=5 January 2018 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all}} {{quote|The ideology of the NA serves outstanding contemporary philosophers: [[Gregory Bateson]], [[Ken Wilber]], [[Paul Feyerabend]]. On a grand scale is the creation and support of international organizations, contained in the ideology of the NA. In [[Russia]] and in [[Ukraine]], International movement "To Health via Culture", based on the teachings of Agni Yoga, operates and has a great publishing activity.}} The WOCH has its own publishing house ("To Health via Culture"), who has the right to publish the books with the [[International Standard Book Number]] (ISBN). ''The Journal of the World Organisation of Culture of Health (″World Health Culture Organization″)'' is based in [[Novocheboksarsk#Media|Novocheboksarsk]]. The journal received an [[International Standard Serial Number]] (ISSN) 0204-3440.{{cite web |url=http://catalog.loc.gov/vwebv/search?searchCode=STNO&searchType=1&recCount=25&searchArg=0204-3440 |title=K zdorovʹi︠u︡ cherez kulʹturu: zhurnal Mezhdunarodnogo obshchestvennogo dvizhenii︠a︡ "K zdorovʹi︠u︡ cherez kulʹturu" |trans-title=To health via culture: journal of the World Health Culture Organization |publisher=catalog.loc.gov |oclc=70966742 |accessdate=18 November 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6pppaZG8a?url=https://catalog.loc.gov/vwebv/search?searchCode=STNO&searchType=1&recCount=25&searchArg=0204-3440 |archivedate=19 April 2017}} The main topics of the magazine are the dissemination of ideas of culture of health, [[holistic medicine]], [[Rerikhism]], and Agni Yoga.{{cite journal |url=http://biblmdkz.ru/articles/j25_3.html |title=Skumin's sutras of Agni Yoga. Russian-English parallel texts. Leaves of Morya's garden. Book One: The Call |author=Ostrovidova L. A. |year=2016 |journal=To Health via Culture |volume=25 |pages=16–28 |issn=0204-3440 |accessdate=25 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6vmd25LqV?url=http://biblmdkz.ru/articles/j25_3.html |archivedate=17 December 2017 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all }} ==The Holy Scripture of Agni Yoga== [[File:Obshina (orbital station Mir).jpg |thumb |right |230px |The book "New Era Community" (Russian: ″Община″{{cite web| url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_ru/New-Era-Community.php |title=New Era Community |trans-title=Община |publisher=agniyoga.org |year=1926 |language=Russian |accessdate=17 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73F0TJpwy?url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_ru/New-Era-Community.php |archivedate=17 October 2018}}) which was on board of [[orbital station]] "[[Mir]]", 1999.]] [[File:Обложка книги «Чаша Востока. I. Письма Махатмы. Перевод Искандер Ханум (Е.И. Рерих). Нью-Йорк, Париж, Рига, Харбин. Алатас, 1925».jpg |right | thumb| 230 px| Cover of the book "Chalice of the East. Letters of Mahatma" (Pussian: "Чаша Востока. Письма Махатмы". Translated by Iskander Hanum ([[Helena Roerich]]), 1925.{{cite web |url=http://ligatma.org/mahatma_letters/chasha_vostoka/letter1.html |title=Chalice of the East. Letters of Mahatma |trans-title=Чаша Востока. Письма Махатмы |publisher=Alatas |location=[[New York City|New York]], [[Paris]], [[Riga]], [[Harbin]] |language=Russian |accessdate=29 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73ANweeX3?url=http://ligatma.org/mahatma_letters/chasha_vostoka/letter1.html |archivedate=14 October 2018}}]] The beginning of the religious and philosophical ''series of Agni Yoga'' was delivered on March 24, 1920.{{cite book |url=https://books.google.ru/books?id=CCgKBgAAQBAJ&pg=PA19&lpg=PA19&dq=chalice+of+the+east+helena+roerich&source=bl&ots=26zpruVvSL&sig=UrAm_D7PZwRiQjjqdyIpI8xfwvI&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwj5-f2l7bneAhXJjiwKHaIGDso4ChDoATAIegQIARAB#v=onepage&q=chalice%20of%20the%20east%20helena%20roerich&f=false |author=Daniel H. Shubin |title=Helena Roerich: Living Ethics and the Teaching for a New Epoch (Agni Yoga) |publisher=books.google.ru |year=2013 |page=11 |isbn=978-0-9662757-4-2 |accessdate=4 November 2018}} These Roerichs records eventually became the ''[[Holy Scripture]]'', consisting of a series of books with a total volume of about 5000 pages.{{cite web| url=http://www.lebendige-ethik-schule.de/whatay.htm |title=What is Agni Yoga? |publisher=lebendige-ethik-schule.de |accessdate=14 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/73AJw9SYe?url=http://www.lebendige-ethik-schule.de/whatay.htm |archivedate=14 October 2018}} # {{cite web| url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Leaves-of-Moryas-Garden-I.php |title=Leaves of Morya’s Garden Book One The Call |publisher=agniyoga.org |year=1924 |accessdate=24 October 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6p2PcH729?url=http://agniyoga.org/ay_en/Leaves-of-Moryas-Garden-I.php |archivedate=17 March 2017}} Transmitted from 1920 to 1923. A. |script-title=ru: Легенды, притчи, сказания Агни Йоги |trans-title=Legends, parables, and stories of Agni Yoga |year=1995 |location=Novocheboksarsk |publisher=Teros |url=http://biblmdkz.ru/legenda.html |language=Russian |isbn=5-88167-008-6 |accessdate=24 September 2018 |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/6wIUZcNij?url=http://biblmdkz.ru/legenda.html |archive-date=7 January 2018 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} ==Gallery== Many works of [[Nicholas Roerich]] and [[Svetoslav Roerich]], as an [[artist]]s, are thematically related to Agni Yoga.{{cite web |url=https://images.search.yahoo.com/search/images;_ylt=AwrEwNVkYZ5b7LEAQHKJzbkF;_ylu=X3oDMTBsZ29xY3ZzBHNlYwNzZWFyY2gEc2xrA2J1dHRvbg--;_?pvid=doj9mzEwLjG9x2rnWYQ5IwKlOTUuMgAAAABxmGQe&p=nicholas+roerich+svetoslav+roerich+agni+yoga&fr=yfp-t-s&fr2=sb-top-images.search.yahoo.com&ei=UTF-8&n=60&x=wrt |title=Images |publisher=yahoo.com |accessdate=16 September 2018}} Roerichs artistic works speak about the internal needs of the individual and about the ways of their realization. Roerich's paintings are a kind of ''Teaching of Life'', on the spiritual development of mankind, about culture and its role in human life. This is a conversation about the [[Eternity]].{{cite web |url=http://www.roerich.org/museum-about.php |title=The Museum Collection |publisher=Nicholas Roerich Museum NY |accessdate=29 September 2018 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6j1nfmzWO?url=http://www.roerich.org/museum-about.php |archivedate=15 July 2016}} File:She who leads.jpg |

Nicholas Roerich.Command of Rigden Djapo. 1924.{{cite web |url=https://roerichmongoliamonthly.wordpress.com/2011/07/30/vol-7-prof-s-bira-portrait-of-a-mongol-hero-2/ |year=2011 |title=Roerich Mongolia Monthly Vol 7: Prof. S. Bira, Portrait of a Mongol Hero |publisher=roerichmongoliamonthly.wordpress.com |accessdate=21 November 2018 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/746Gk9Q0Y |archivedate=21 November 2018}}
«The painting "Rigden Djapo" or "[[King of Shambhala]]" is one of the many paintings created by [[Nicholas Roerich]] during his residence in [[Ulaanbaatar]] in 1926-1927. This painting was presented by Roerich to the Mongolian government in 1927. Its survival was in doubt for many years. It was rediscovered in 1958 at Ulaanbaatar during the Prof. [[George de Roerich]] visit with Prof. [[Shagdaryn Bira]] as guide.» File:Tsong-Kha-Pa.jpg |

The '''Amiiformes''' [[order (biology)|order]] of [[fish]] has only one extant species, the [[bowfin]] (''Amia calva'').

{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2015}} {{Use Australian English|date=September 2015}} {{Infobox AFL biography | name = Bill Heaphy | image = | fullname = William Heaphy | birth_date = {{birth date|1888|12|18|df=yes}} | birth_place = | death_date = {{death date and age|1914|5|21|1888|12|18|df=yes}} | death_place = [[Kyabram]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] | originalteam = [[Tatura Football Club|Tatura]] | height = 177 cm | weight = 75 kg | position = | statsend = 1909 | years1 = 1908–1909 | club1 = [[Essendon Football Club|Essendon]] | games_goals1 = 5 (3) | careerhighlights = }} '''William Heaphy''' (18 December 1888 – 21 May 1914) was an [[Australian rules football]]er who played with [[Essendon Football Club|Essendon]] in the [[Australian Football League|Victorian Football League]] (VFL).<ref>{{cite book|last=Holmesby|first=Russell|last2=Main|first2=Jim|title=The Encyclopedia Of AFL Footballers| publisher=BAS Publishing|year=2007|isbn=9781920910785}}</ref> He was from [[Tatura Football Club|Tatura]] originally and went to [[The Geelong College|Geelong College]], but came to Essendon via [[West Melbourne Football Club|West Melbourne]], during the [[1908 VFL season]].<ref name=Essendon>{{cite web|url=http://www.essendonfc.com.au/team/player-past.asp?id=432 |title=Heaphy, Bill |publisher=Essendon Football Club official website |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120424070458/http://www.essendonfc.com.au/team/player-past.asp?id=432 |archivedate=24 April 2012 }}</ref>
==Essendon== Heaphy made his league debut in Essendon's round 18 win over [[Geelong Football Club|Geelong]] at [[East Melbourne Cricket Ground|East Melbourne]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://afltables.com/afl/stats/games/1908/050919080905.html| title=Essendon v Geelong| publisher=AFL Tables}}</ref>
His second appearance for Essendon was in the [[1908 VFL Grand Final]].<ref name=AFLTables>{{cite web|url=http://afltables.com/afl/stats/games/1908/030519080926.html| title=1908 Grand Final| publisher=AFL Tables}}</ref> He was the youngest player on the field, at 19 years of age, but not the least experienced, as teammate Harry Prout was making his debut.<ref name=AFLTables/><ref>{{cite book|last=Lovett, Michael|title=AFL 2004 - The Official Statistical History Of The AFL| publisher=AFL Publishing|year=2004|isbn=0-9580300-5-7}}</ref> Essendon lost by nine points, with Heaphy playing in a [[forward pocket]].<ref name=Essendon/><ref name=AFLTables/>
He played three games with Essendon in the [[1909 VFL season|1909 season]], then transferred to [[Brunswick Football Club|Brunswick]] mid season and finished the year with another grand final appearance, this time finishing on the winning side.<ref name=Essendon/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://afltables.com/afl/stats/1909.html#5| title=1909 Stats| publisher=AFL Tables}}</ref><ref>''The Coburg Leader'', [http://www.trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/66825235 "Football: Brunswick v Prahran"], 1 October 1909, p. 3</ref>
==Poor health and death== Heaphy had serious issues with his heart and in 1914 spent some time in a Melbourne private hospital.<ref>''Shepparton Advertiser'', [http://www.trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/91359589 "Personal"], 25 May 1914, p. 3</ref> Back at [[Kyabram]] on 21 May 1914, Heaphy suffered a fatal seizure, having earlier taken what he thought was his heart medication.<ref>''Weekly Times (Victoria)'', [http://www.trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/121130575 "Country"], 30 May 1914, p. 26</ref> It was ruled by a coroner that he had been poisoned and gave a verdict of accidental death<ref>''[[Albury Banner and Wodonga Express]]'', [http://www.trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/101420899/10900282 "Victoria"], 29 May 1914, p. 35</ref>
==References== {{reflist|1}}
